isis.stitle: CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 2000, 4000, 7000, AND 8000 SERIES - ADJUSTMENT - PUSH TYPE CLUTCHES

svcprocinfo.para: To obtain the specified release bearing to clutch finger clearance ( Figure 2), adjust the clutch linkage as outlined on the next page. This adjustment will provide specified pedal free travel.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Release Bearing Clearance (Push Type Clutches)

svcsubproc.title: Vehicles With the Adjusting Yoke at the Front End of the Lower (Horizontal) Control Rod:

step1.para: Loosen the lower (horizontal) clutch control rod adjusting yoke lock nut.
Remove the cotter pin and clevis pin and disconnect the lower control rod from the relay inner lever.
Insert a .28" (7 mm) spacer gauge between the clutch pedal shank and pedal return stop. (Gauge can be made locally.)

important.para: Use .34" (8.8 mm) spacer gauge on vehicles having the pedal return spring connected to the upper (vertical) clutch control rod.

step1.para: Pull the lower control rod forward until the release bearing contacts the clutch fingers.
Holding the rod in the forward position (per Step 4), adjust the control rod yoke until the clevis pin can be freely inserted through the yoke and relay shaft lever.
Tighten the control rod yoke lock nut and install a new cotter pin.
Operate the clutch pedal and check clutch release. The clutch should fully release before the clutch pedal contacts the floor panel.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicles With Adjusting Yoke at the Rear End of the Lower (Horizontal) Control Rod:

step1.para: Loosen the lower (horizontal) clutch control rod adjusting yoke lock nut.
Remove the cotter pin and clevis pin and disconnect the lower control rod from the release shaft lever.
Insert a .28" (7 mm) spacer gauge between the clutch pedal shank and the pedal return stop. (Gauge can be made locally.)

important.para: Use .34" (8.8 mm) spacer gauge on vehicles having the pedal return spring connected to the upper (vertical) clutch control rod.

step1.para: Pull the release shaft lever forward until the release bearing contacts the clutch fingers.
Holding lever in forward position (per Step 4), adjust the control rod yoke until the clevis pin can be freely inserted through the yoke and release shaft lever.
Tighten the control rod yoke lock nut and install the new cotter pin.
Operate the clutch pedal and check clutch release. The clutch should fully release before the clutch pedal contacts floor panel.
